data.enText: mind/feelings/character
the part of a person that includes their mind, feelings and character rather than their body
the power of the human spirit to overcome difficulties
data.chText: 人类克服困难的精神力量

data.enText: a person's feelings or state of mind
to be in high/low spirits
You must try and keep your spirits up (= stay cheerful) .
data.chText: 你必须设法保持高昂的情绪。

data.enText: My spirits sank at the prospect of starting all over again.
data.chText: 想到一切都得从头再来，我的情绪一下子低落了。

data.enText: a person of the type mentioned
a brave spirit
kindred spirits (= people who like the same things as you)
courage/determination
courage, determination or energy
Show a little fighting spirit .
Although the team lost, they played with tremendous spirit.
data.chText: 尽管输了，但队员表现得极为勇猛。

data.enText: They took away his freedom and broke his spirit.
data.chText: 他们夺去了他的自由，摧垮了他的意志。

data.enText: loyal feelings
loyal feelings towards a group, team or society
There's not much community spirit around here.
data.chText: 这里集体精神比较薄弱。

data.enText: attitude
a state of mind or mood; an attitude
We approached the situation in the wrong spirit.
data.chText: 我们以前对待局势的心态不对。

data.enText: ‘OK, I'll try.’ ‘ That's the spirit (= the right attitude) .’
The party went well because everyone entered into the spirit of things .
data.chText: 晚会很成功，因为每个人都很投入。

data.enText: typical quality
the typical or most important quality or mood of sth
The exhibition captures the spirit of the age/times .
data.chText: 这个展览会抓住了时代精神。

data.enText: real meaning
the real or intended meaning or purpose of sth
Obey the spirit, not the letter (= the narrow meaning of the words) of the law.
data.chText: 要依照法律的精神实质，而不是字面意思。

data.enText: soul
the soul thought of as separate from the body and believed to live on after death; a ghost
He is dead, but his spirit lives on.
data.chText: 他死了，但他的灵魂将永存。

data.enText: It was believed that people could be possessed by evil spirits.
data.chText: 以前，人们相信人有可能被恶魔缠身。

data.enText: imaginary creature
an imaginary creature with magic powers, for example, a fairy or an elf
alcohol
a strong alcoholic drink
I don't drink whisky or brandy or any other spirits.
data.chText: 我不喝威士忌和白兰地，也不喝其他烈性酒。

data.enText: a special type of alcohol used in industry or medicine
in spirit
in your thoughts
I shall be with you in spirit (= thinking about you though not with you physically) .
the spirit is willing (but the flesh is weak)
you intend to do good things but you are too lazy, weak or busy to actually do them
data.chText: 心灵固然愿意，肉体却软弱；心有余而力不足；力不从心

data.enText: as/when/if the spirit moves you
as/when/if you feel like it
I'll go for a run this evening, if the spirit moves me.
data.chText: 晚上要是有兴致的话，我要去跑步。

data.enText: fighting spirit
a feeling that you are ready to fight very hard for sth or to try sth difficult
raise sb's spirits
to make sb feel more cheerful or brave
to take sb/sth away in a quick, secret or mysterious way
data.chText: 偷偷带走；让人不可思议地弄走

data.enText: After the concert, the band was spirited away before their fans could get near them.
data.chText: 音乐会结束后，乐队没等歌迷靠近就神秘地消失了。

simple_means.memory_skill: spir 呼吸 + -it 名词后缀

ex.zh: 自由的态度；无拘无束的人

data.enText: in spirit
in your thoughts
I shall be with you in spirit (= thinking about you though not with you physically) .
the spirit is willing (but the flesh is weak)
you intend to do good things but you are too lazy, weak or busy to actually do them
data.chText: 心灵固然愿意，肉体却软弱；心有余而力不足；力不从心

data.enText: as/when/if the spirit moves you
as/when/if you feel like it
I'll go for a run this evening, if the spirit moves me.
data.chText: 晚上要是有兴致的话，我要去跑步。

data.enText: fighting spirit
a feeling that you are ready to fight very hard for sth or to try sth difficult
raise sb's spirits
to make sb feel more cheerful or brave

tr: a fundamental emotional and activating principle determining one's character
an inclination or tendency of a certain kind
example: he had a change of heart

tr: animation and energy in action or expression
example: it was a heavy play and the actors tried in vain to give life to it

tr: the intended meaning of a communication
any incorporeal supernatural being that can become visible (or audible) to human beings
the vital principle or animating force within living things
the state of a person's emotions (especially with regard to pleasure or dejection)
example: his emotional state depended on her opinion

tr: the general atmosphere of a place or situation and the effect that it has on people
example: the feel of the city excited him
a clergyman improved the tone of the meeting
it had the smell of treason

example.ex: The human spirit is virtually indestructible...
example.tran: 人的精神实际上是不可摧毁的。

example.ex: Marian retains a restless, youthful spirit, in search of new horizons.
example.tran: 玛丽安怀着一颗年轻、不断进取的心去寻求新的天地。

value.def: Your spirit is the part of you that is not physical and that consists of your character and feelings.

example.ex: His spirit has left him and all that remains is the shell of his body.
example.tran: 他已灵魂出窍，剩下的只是他的躯壳。

value.def: A person's spirit is the non-physical part of them that is believed to remain alive after their death.

example.ex: ...protection against evil spirits.
example.tran: 避邪

value.def: A spirit is a ghost or supernatural being.

example.ex: She was a very brave girl and everyone who knew her admired her spirit.
example.tran: 她是个非常勇敢的女孩，认识她的人都敬佩她的勇气。

value.def: Spirit is the courage and determination that helps people to survive in difficult times and to keep their way of life and their beliefs.

example.ex: They played with spirit.
example.tran: 他们打得生龙活虎。

value.def: Spirit is the liveliness and energy that someone shows in what they do.

example.ex: Their problem can only be solved in a spirit of compromise...
example.tran: 他们的问题只能通过妥协来解决。

example.ex: They approached the talks in a conciliatory spirit.
example.tran: 他们抱一种和解的态度去参加谈判。

value.def: The spirit in which you do something is the attitude you have when you are doing it.

example.ex: There is a great sense of team spirit among the British Olympic squad...
example.tran: 在英国的奥运代表团中有一种强烈的团队精神。

example.ex: The president has appealed to the Brazilian people for patriotism and community spirit.
example.tran: 总统已经呼吁巴西人民要有爱国情怀和集体主义精神。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft n N

value.def: A particular kind of spirit is the feeling of loyalty to a group that is shared by the people who belong to the group.

example.ex: ...the real spirit of the Labour movement.
example.tran: 劳工运动的精髓

value.def: A particular kind of spirit is the set of ideas, beliefs, and aims that are held by a group of people.
value.tran: 精神(指某一群体特有的思想、信念、目标)

example.ex: The requirement for work permits violates the spirit of the 1950 treaty.
example.tran: 对工作许可证的要求违反了 1950 年条约的精神。

value.def: The spirit of something such as a law or an agreement is the way that it was intended to be interpreted or applied.
value.tran: (法律、协议等的)原意,实质，精神

example.ex: I like to think of myself as a free spirit...
example.tran: 我愿意把自己看成是个无拘无束的人。

example.ex: He was the founder and guiding spirit of New York's Shakespeare Festival.
example.tran: 他是纽约莎士比亚戏剧节的创始人及领导者。

value.def: You can refer to a person as a particular kind of spirit if they show a certain characteristic or if they show a lot of enthusiasm in what they are doing.

example.ex: At supper, everyone was in high spirits...
example.tran: 晚餐时，每个人都兴致勃勃。

example.ex: A bit of exercise will help lift his spirits.
example.tran: 进行一点儿体育锻炼能帮助他改善情绪。

value.def: Your spirits are your feelings at a particular time, especially feelings of happiness or unhappiness.

example.ex: He was spirited away and probably murdered...
example.tran: 他被秘密带走，可能被杀害了。

example.ex: His parents had spirited him away to the country...
example.tran: 他的父母偷偷地将他带到了该国。

example.ex: It is possible that he has been spirited out of the country.
example.tran: 可能他已经被偷偷带出了国。

value.def: If someone or something is spirited away, or if they are spirited out of somewhere, they are taken from a place quickly and secretly without anyone noticing.
Spirits are strong alcoholic drinks such as whisky and gin.
Spirit or spirits is an alcoholic liquid that is used as a fuel, for cleaning things, or for other purposes. There are many kinds of spirit.
value.tran: (用作燃料、清洗等用途的)酒精

value.def: If you enter into the spirit of something, you take part in it in an enthusiastic way.

example.ex: In spirit I was with you here.
example.tran: 我在精神上支持你。

value.def: If you say you are somewhere in spirit or with someone in spirit, you mean that although you are not with them, you feel as though you are with them because you are thinking about them a lot.
value.tran: 精神上(在某地或和某人在一起，但实际上本人并不在场)

example.ex: They seemed close in spirit to those first independent-minded Turkish women who took professions...
example.tran: 她们在本质上似乎和那些最早出去工作的具有独立思想的土耳其女性很相似。

example.ex: It is independent in spirit.
example.tran: 它本质上是独立的。

value.def: You use in spirit when you are talking about someone's true nature.
The spirit of the age or the spirit of the times is the set of ideas, beliefs, and aims that is typical of people in a particular period in history.

trans: 合作精神；集体精神；团队精神
圣灵；大地圣灵；聖靈；圣神；神圣精神
奥林匹克精神；奥运精神
国家精神；民族精神；弘扬民族精神；国民精神；美国人的国酒
本质上；精神上(在某地或和某人在一起，但实际上本人并不在场)
开拓精神；闯劲；创新精神；首创精神；开拓进取
进取精神，；创业精神，事（企）业精神
专业精神；职业精神；业精神
独立自主的人；有主见的人

partsOfSpeech.dec: pursu(e) 追赶 + -it 名词后缀
summ 总结,概括 + -it 名词后缀
de- 离开,向下 + fic 做,制作 + -it 名词后缀
im- 否定 + plic 重叠,折叠 + -it 名词后缀
